Group.title: UserAdmin Module Required Settings
Group.description: To support a secured and compliant configuration, a number of user account settings need to be modified from there default configuration.

Value.title: number of days account inactivity until the account is permanently disabled
Value.description: The number of days to wait after not logging in to an account, until the account will be permanently disabled.
Value.warning: This will only apply to newly created accounts

Value.title: maximum password age
Value.description: Maximum age of password in days
Value.warning: This will only apply to newly created accounts

Value.title: minimum password age
Value.description: Minimum age of password in days
Value.warning: This will only apply to newly created accounts

Value.title: warning days before password expires
Value.description: The number of days' warning given before a password expires.
Value.warning: This will only apply to newly created accounts

Value.title: password hash algorithm
Value.description: The hash algorithm used to store user passwords.
Value.warning: This will only apply to newly created accounts

Value.title: minimum password length
Value.description: Minimum number of characters in password
Value.warning: This will only check new passwords

Rule.title: Configure new accounts to create their home directory with a default permission setting of 750.
Rule.description: New users created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must have the default permissions of 750 applied to their home directory when created.

Rule.title: Configure new accounts to lock out after a number of days of no activity.
Rule.description: New users created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must include required account expiration criteria.

Rule.title: Configure new accounts to expire their password after a maximum number days.
Rule.description: New users created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must include required maximum password life criteria.

Rule.title: Configure new accounts to prevent changing passwords more than once per the minimum number of days defined.
Rule.description: New users created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must include required minimum password life criteria.

Rule.title: Configure new accounts to warn the user about their password expiring.
Rule.description: New users created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must include required account password expiration warning criteria.

Rule.title: Configure the UserAdmin Webmin module to store passwords created using a specified hashing algorithm.
Rule.description: Passwords generated through the UserAdmin Webmin module must be stored using the specified hashing algorithm.

Rule.title: Configure the UserAdmin Webmin module to require a minimum number of characters in passwords defined.
Rule.description: Passwords created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must include the minimum defined number of characters in the password.

Rule.title: Configure the UserAdmin Webmin module to require at least 1 upper-case character, 1 lower-case character, 1 numeric character, and 1 special character.
Rule.description: Passwords created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must include at least 1 upper-case character, 1 lower-case character, 1 numeric character, and 1 special character.

Rule.title: Configure the UserAdmin Webmin module to require passwords to not include dictionary words.
Rule.description: Passwords created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must not include dictionary words.

Rule.title: Configure the UserAdmin Webmin module to require passwords to be different from the previously configured password.
Rule.description: Passwords created through the UserAdmin Webmin module must not be the same as the previous password used.

Rule.title: Configure the UserAdmin Webmin module to mask the password characters entered with stars.
Rule.description: The UserAdmin Webmin module must not display the characters entered for the password in clear text.

Rule.title: Configure the UserAdmin Webmin module to display last login information for all users.
Rule.description: User last login information must be displayed to support detecting unauthorized access.
